description: Alterations including creation of roof terrace at Level 03 of 20 - 23 Blades Court and extension of staircase provide associated access. Alterations to provide access between the two existing buildings.
subdivision_of_building: Populous currently occupy a number of units within Blades Court: 14 - 19, 20 - 23, 24 and 25. This application relates to 20 - 23 Blades Court only.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The applicant is advised that landowners are permitted, under Common Law, to prune back any branches that overhang their boundary. If this work leads to failure of the tree, then the landowner would be liable for any damages. A landowner cannot access the neighbouring property to facilitate this (without permission).

Condition : 2 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the reports, specifications and drawings detailed 0300-00; 0301-00; 0302-00; 0104-00; 0105-00; 0106-00; 0107-00; 0109-00; 0200-00; 0201-00; 0202-00; 0203-00; Ref: 2325 - Blades Court - LR 11/23 Rev B; Bat Mitigation Plan dated 29/10/2024; Arbtech AIA 03; Arbtech TPP 03; Arbtech AMS 03. 
Reason: To ensure a satisfactory standard of development and to allow the local planning authority to review any potential changes to the scheme.

Condition : 3 - Prior to commencement of use of the terrace as shown on drawings the planter boxes and perforated metal baslustrade to each side and rear shall be installed. The screening shall be retained and maintained as such thereafter.
Reason: To protect the privacy of neighbours by preventing overlooking and in the interest of visual amenity in accordance with Council policies LP1 and LP2 of the Local Plan coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework.

Condition : 4 - The roof terrace hereby permitted shall not be used other than between the hours of 0800 and 2200 Monday to Friday unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority. Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the neighbourhood, in accordance with Council policy LP2 of the Local Plan coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework.

Condition : 5 - No playing of any music or other amplified sound/voices shall take place on the roof terrace hereby approved at any time. Reason: To safeguard the amenities of residential occupiers, in accordance with Council policy LP2 of the Local Plan coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework.

Condition : 6 - Prior to the�use of the terrace a Post Completion Light Spillage Report demonstrating that the "as built" lighting is in accordance with the lighting specifications outlined in condition 5 of this decision notice, shall be submitted and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The approved lighting shall only be used/operated between hours of 0800 and 2200 Monday to Friday. Reason: to prevent harm to protected and priority species in accordance with Policy LP55 of the Local plan coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2023

Condition : 7 - The lighting permitted by this planning permission shall only be carried out in accordance with the approved lighting specification detailed Ref: 2325 Blades Court LR 11/23 Rev B and shall be retained as such.
Reason: to prevent harm to protected and priority species in accordance with Policy LP55 of the Local plan coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2023

Condition : 8 - INFORMATIVE: In dealing with this application the Council has implemented the requirement in the National Planning Policy Framework to work with the applicant in a positive and proactive manner and the Council has, as far as practicable, sought solutions to problems arising in relation to dealing with the planning application. The Council has made available detailed advice in the form of its statutory policies in the Local Plan (2023) as well as offering a full pre-application advice service, in order to ensure that the applicant has been given every opportunity to submit an application which is likely to be considered favourably. In addition, where appropriate, further guidance was offered to the applicant during the processing of the application.
